body:
Anyone like to help with this?

If you'd like to see this then please +1 the above!

Sorry never learned (yet) Golang, otherwise would be glad to write this.

Actually, i'm trying to use their FTP (very limited, only uploads to root and no `mkdir` or other things...) but i get an error at every upload with `rclone`

`Failed to copy: update getinfo: object not found`

Nothing related with https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/1982#issuecomment-450559447 as all my files have this naming `2018-07-11_00h35m56s-my-name.zip` and the behavior is exactly the same than https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/1982#issuecomment-450511409

Running command is `rclone copy /var/backups/rclone/ 1fichier:` as `1fichier` is just a `FTP` remote.
(inside source dir there are only files like `2018-07-11_00h35m56s-my-name.zip`)

No problem with any FTP client (like Filezilla or Cyberduck).

**Can provide an FTP account at their end for testing if needed.**

issue.title: Failed to copy: update getinfo: object not found

milestone.title: Known Problem
milestone.description: This milestone contains issues which are known problems which are proving difficult to fix, or are awaiting an external fix or we haven't got round to yet.

```

- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.9.2
```

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

ubuntu16.04.3

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

ftp

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone -vv sync /www/wwwroot/anime/* woot:/public_html/ni-co.moe/anime/public_html`

body:
@acs-ferreira wrote:
> Can provide an FTP account at their end for testing if needed.

That would be very useful :-)

Can you email details to nick@craig-wood.com with subject "rclone issue 2908" - thanks :-)

> Actually, i'm trying to use their FTP (very limited, only uploads to root and no `mkdir` or other things...) but i get an error at every upload with `rclone`

In our email exchange we established that the 1fichier FTP acts very much like an anonymous FTP. The `LIST dir` command is broken and files can't be downloaded and directories can't be made.  Those limitations made us think that making rclone work with the 1fichier FTP wouldn't be easily possible.

I believe this is not true as the API does not use the FTP at all. The FTP is provided by them only if the API or the Web upload can't be used.

The API is actually used trough PHP and it works perfectly fine. :blush: 

So, use Rclone with the FTP will not work (one should use cURL instead) but Rclone with their API _should_  work fine.

> So, use Rclone with the FTP will not work (one should use cURL instead) but Rclone with their API _should_ work fine.

That is exactly what I meant, apologies if it wasn't clear :-)

issue.title: WIP: 1fichier Support

body:
First beta is here of the 1ficher backend if anyone wants to have a go:

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.48.0-031-ga8f7dbed-fichier-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.49

Testing and bug reports appreciated!
Can this mounted with a classic `rclone mount` ?

> Can this mounted with a classic `rclone mount` ?

Sure!
